intro: Gymnosporia diversifolia, commonly known as the many-fruit burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, thorny growth. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, spiny capsules containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough, textured surface. Gymnosporia diversifolia is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
